FuncDef:
The peer advertise-large-community command enables a device to advertise the Large-Community attribute to a peer.
The undo peer advertise-large-community command cancels the configuration. The peer advertise-large-community command enables a device to advertise the Large-Community attribute to a peer. The undo peer advertise-large-community command cancels the configuration. By default, a device does not advertise the Large-Community attribute to its peer. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a BGP EVPN peer.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Disables a device from advertising the Large-Community attribute to a peer.
-

ExtraInfo: To enable a device to advertise the Large-Community attribute to its BGP peer, run the peer advertise-large-community command.
